metadata.title: CVE-2017-9115 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Certified (focal) - low
metadata.description:
In OpenEXR 2.2.0, an invalid write of size 2 in the = operator function inhalf.h could cause the application to crash or execute arbitrary code.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-9115` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libopenexr24 - 2.3.0-6ubuntu0.1
openexr - 2.3.0-6ubuntu0.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: openexr package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.3.0-6ubuntu0.1').
